name: Blues Saraceno
description:
'''Blues Saraceno''' (born October 17, 1971) is an American rock guitarist, composer and music producer, currently residing in [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]]. He was discovered by ''[[Guitar for the Practicing Musician]]'' magazine at the age of 16, which assisted him in releasing [[instrumental rock|instrumental]] recordings on an independent basis.

Saraceno's high profile as a gifted guitar virtuoso and musician opened the doors to an early career as a first-call guitar sideman and session musician. Saraceno is most often recognized from his time playing with Jack Bruce and Ginger Baker ([[Cream (band)|Cream]]) as well as his brief tenure with the rock band [[Poison (band)|Poison]]. Saraceno's early success in the music industry would eventually blossom into a career in producing and composing for television and film.
